p: For the HCT-116 cell line (colon carcinoma) ( Fig 5A), regardless of the geographical origin of the sample or the extraction conditions employed, all extracts had a percent inhibition greater than 90%. In general, few significant differences (p>0.05) were observed for the percent inhibition for the HL-60 (leukemia) ( Fig 5B) and PC3 (prostate carcinoma) cell lines ( Fig 5C) when evaluating the different extracts (two extraction methods and six samples from different sources). For these lines, all of the extracts had a percent inhibition above 80% (except for extract D2, which showed no inhibition against HL-60). In general, for these three tumor lines, the extraction method used did not influence the cytotoxic response ( Fig 5A, 5B and 5C).
